channel.title: I Freeze When Attacking NPC
channel.description:
Hey guys. Every time anyone attacks an NPC on my server, the client freezes. What can I do to fix this?
[img]http://i.imgur.com/6Bz1vqU.png[/img]

item.title: I Freeze When Attacking NPC
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:554669”][quote author=FizzerX637 link=topic=673594.msg4503943#msg4503943 date=1454912747]

Is it any npc? is it any attack?

Because it looks like you’re probably sending the wrong values to the client…
Ex: sending an animation id for an animation that doesn’t exist.

When I attack an NPC such as the skeleton in the edge wild, it doesnt freeze until the skeleton actually dies. But when i attack a man or frost dragon it freezes right as a hit it. Now that i have your comment in mind, ill play with it and see what i can figure out, thank you.

Disable death animations for NPCs, and then kill the skeleton.
If it freezes again, it’s not the anims. If it doesn’t freeze, it’s the anims.

Tested magic on skeleton. I killed the skeleton without a problem. Tested magic on man and froze immediately. About to delete the death anims rn.
[/quote]
It may not just be death animations
Are you loading new data on your client?
I.E: Running a 317 client but have 602 anims.
If you are, the issue might be the anim ids got update or replaced, or they’re not being read in the client correctly.

Or, is your server setup for new data but you actually have older?
I.E: Your server was connected to a client that had 602 anims, but then you changed the client to one with 474 anims.
If this is the case, you are sending values to the client that doesn’t exist.[/quote]

Thank you so much, Sk8rdude461. You helped a lot, with the last comment. I know what I did. I appreciate the help!

Read full topic

item.title: I Freeze When Attacking NPC
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“FizzerX637, post:5, topic:554669”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=673594.msg4503928#msg4503928 date=1454898250]

Is it any npc? is it any attack?

Because it looks like you’re probably sending the wrong values to the client…
Ex: sending an animation id for an animation that doesn’t exist.

When I attack an NPC such as the skeleton in the edge wild, it doesnt freeze until the skeleton actually dies. But when i attack a man or frost dragon it freezes right as a hit it. Now that i have your comment in mind, ill play with it and see what i can figure out, thank you.

Disable death animations for NPCs, and then kill the skeleton.
If it freezes again, it’s not the anims. If it doesn’t freeze, it’s the anims.
[/quote]

Tested magic on skeleton. I killed the skeleton without a problem. Tested magic on man and froze immediately. About to delete the death anims rn.[/quote]
It may not just be death animations
Are you loading new data on your client?
I.E: Running a 317 client but have 602 anims.
If you are, the issue might be the anim ids got update or replaced, or they’re not being read in the client correctly.

Or, is your server setup for new data but you actually have older?
I.E: Your server was connected to a client that had 602 anims, but then you changed the client to one with 474 anims.
If this is the case, you are sending values to the client that doesn’t exist.

Read full topic
